meanings.definition: To place (cremated remains) in an urn.
meanings.sent1: She carefully inurns the ashes of her beloved pet in a beautiful urn.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to inurn the ashes of their loved one in a peaceful garden.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up at the funeral home, they accidentally inurned the wrong ashes.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood inurned in her mind like treasures in a hidden chest.
meanings.sent5: The act of inurning the ashes symbolizes the eternal bond between the living and the departed.

meanings.definition: To inter (cremated remains) in an urn.
meanings.sent1: The cemetery inurns the urns of the deceased in a solemn ceremony.
meanings.sent2: Families often choose to inurn the ashes of their loved ones in a peaceful mausoleum.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to inurn acorns in the flower pots around the cemetery.
meanings.sent4: The history of the ancient civilization is inurned in the artifacts unearthed by archaeologists.
meanings.sent5: The sense of peace inurned within the walls of the memorial garden brings solace to visitors.
